meanings.definition: Lacking cohesion or connection; not logically connected; disjointed.
meanings.sent1: The incoherent story jumped from one idea to another without any clear link.
meanings.sent2: Her incoherent ramblings made it difficult to understand what she was trying to say.
meanings.sent3: The incoherent puzzle pieces were scattered all over the table, making it impossible to put together.
meanings.sent4: His incoherent thoughts resembled a jumbled mess of tangled wires, impossible to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The incoherent speech sounded like a garbled mix of random words, leaving everyone confused.

meanings.definition: Unable to express oneself clearly or coherently; unintelligible.
meanings.sent1: The toddler's incoherent babbling amused everyone at the family gathering.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture became incoherent as he tried to explain the complex theory.
meanings.sent3: The incoherent message left on the voicemail made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her incoherent handwriting on the note made it impossible to decipher what she had written.
meanings.sent5: The incoherent lyrics of the song seemed like a jumble of nonsensical words strung together.
